info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 2:50AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties through 315 AM PDT... At 249 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northwest of Midland, or 30 miles northeast of Desert Center. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties. This includes CA Route 177 between mile markers 18 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
